description: When the user feels alone, abandoned, or emotionally/spiritually distant — needing comfort, divine presence, and connection.

primary.text_en: And when My servants ask you about Me, indeed I am near. I respond to the call of the caller when he calls upon Me...
primary.text_ar: وَإِذَا سَأَلَكَ عِبَادِى عَنِّي فَإِنِّي قَرِيبٌ...
primary.explanation: You're never alone. Allah responds to every sincere call — immediately.

primary.text_en: ...Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us...
primary.explanation: Spoken in the darkest moment of Hijrah — a reminder that Allah is always with the believers.

primary.text_en: Your Lord has not abandoned you, nor has He detested you.
primary.explanation: To every heart that feels ignored by Allah — this is your answer.

primary.text_en: Do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah...
primary.text_ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَيۡـَٔسُ مِن رَّوۡحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلۡقَوۡمُ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ
primary.explanation: Even in a dungeon, Yusuf (AS) never lost hope. This ayah lifts the isolated soul.

primary.text_en: But Allah is most knowing of your enemies. And sufficient is Allah as an ally, and sufficient is Allah as a helper.
primary.text_ar: وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَلِيًّۭا وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ نَصِيرًۭا
primary.explanation: When you feel like no one’s on your side — Allah is enough.

extra.text_en: And He is with you wherever you are. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
extra.explanation: Wherever you are — even in isolation — Allah is present.

extra.text_en: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
extra.text_ar: لَا تُدْرِكُهُ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ وَهُوَ يُدْرِكُ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ
extra.explanation: You may not 'see' Allah, but He sees your tears, your thoughts, your silence.

extra.text_en: There is none in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
extra.text_ar: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَبْدًۭا
extra.explanation: You’re never alone — you’re part of a universe that belongs to Him.
The pain of loneliness won’t last forever — ease is on its way.

extra.text_en: Whoever does righteousness... We will surely grant them a good life...
extra.explanation: A peaceful heart and fulfilling life come from righteousness — not numbers or people.

primary.text_en: Allah is with the servant as long as the servant is with his brother.
primary.explanation: Helping others builds divine presence and removes loneliness.

primary.text_en: The closest people to Allah are those who bring benefit to His creation.
primary.explanation: Connection often starts when you comfort others — and find Allah with you.

primary.text_en: No one is alone who has Allah as his companion.
primary.source: Sahih meaning, based on several narrations
primary.explanation: The best companionship is divine. Turn inward to find it.

primary.text_en: Remember Allah in times of ease and He will remember you in times of hardship.
primary.explanation: If you feel forgotten, start remembering — the connection returns.

primary.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'I was not sent except as a mercy to the worlds.'
primary.explanation: Your loneliness is not ignored — mercy was sent specifically for hearts like yours.

extra.text_en: Whoever relieves a believer’s distress, Allah will relieve his distress on the Day of Resurrection.
extra.explanation: Start with easing someone else’s loneliness — it will ease your own.

extra.text_en: The hearts are between the fingers of Allah — He turns them as He wills.
extra.explanation: Your state of isolation can change in a moment — just keep turning to Him.

extra.text_en: If Allah loves someone, He calls out to Jibreel: 'I love so-and-so, so love him…'
extra.explanation: Feeling unloved? Know that Allah *publicly* declares love for His beloveds.

extra.text_en: None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
extra.explanation: A reminder that genuine connections are rooted in sincere love — seek that.

extra.text_en: He who secludes himself (for worship) is not alone if he remembers Allah.
extra.source: Meaning from many Athar (Salaf and Hadith)
extra.explanation: Isolation with dhikr turns loneliness into spiritual retreat.

duas.text_en: O Allah, be my Companion in loneliness, my Comfort in sorrow, and my Strength in weakness.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ كُنْ لِي فِي الْوَحْدَةِ صَاحِبًا، وَفِي الْغَمِّ فَرَجًا، وَفِي الضَّعْفِ قُوَّةً
duas.source: Adapted from various supplications of the righteous
duas.explanation: A heartfelt plea to transform isolation into divine closeness.

duas.text_en: O Allah, I ask You for Your love, and the love of those who love You, and actions that bring me closer to Your love.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ حُبَّكَ، وَحُبَّ مَنْ يُحِبُّكَ...
duas.explanation: A dua that builds spiritual intimacy and ends emotional detachment.

reflection: Loneliness is real, but it’s never absolute. You may feel far from the world, but you’re always near to the One who created you. Allah is closer than your jugular vein, watching, listening, understanding. Let your isolation become a conversation with Him. Speak — and you’ll find He never left.
